    Small fish per large fish biomass anomaly

    productivity_anomaly.Rd

    These data represent estimates of recruitment success for species sampled in the NEFSC Bottom Trawl Survey and those calculated for stock assessments.

    productivity_anomaly

    Format

    Data frame with 8241 rows and 5 columns.

    • Var: Common name of surveyed species. If data reflect the aggregated shelf-wide anomaly, then NE LME is included with the species name.

    • EPU: EPU where sampling occurred.

    • Time: Year.

    • Value: Small fish per large fish biomass anomaly.

    • Units: Units of variable Var.

    Details

    Detailed information regarding the derivation of this indicator are present at https://noaa-edab.github.io/tech-doc/fish-productivity-indicator.html.

    References

    Perretti, Charles T., et al. "Regime shifts in fish recruitment on the Northeast US Continental Shelf." Marine Ecology Progress Series 574 (2017): 1-11.

    Wigley, S. E., H. M. McBride, and N. J. McHugh. 2003. “Length-Weight Relationships for 74 Fish Species Collected During NEFSC Research Vessel Bottom Trawl Surveys, 1992-99.” NOAA Technical Memorandum 171. National Marine Fisheries Service.
